snippet: Russian officials said Ryan C. Fogle was an officer of the Central Intelligence Agency who had been caught trying to recruit a Russian to spy for the United States.
abstract: Russian government orders American diplomat Ryan C Fogle to leave the country, claiming he is a Central Intelligence Agency officer who had been caught trying to recruit a Russian to spy for the United States; Pres Vladimir V Putin has long expressed suspicions that Washington is working covertly to undermine him, and it is unclear if latest incident will further damage an already fragile bilateral relationship.

byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN and ELLEN BARRY
byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Andrew E. Kramer and Andrew Roth from Moscow; Mark Mazzetti from Washington; and Steven Lee Myers from Kiruna, Sweden.

lead_paragraph: Russian officials said Ryan C. Fogle was an officer of the Central Intelligence Agency who had been caught trying to recruit a Russian to spy for the United States.

headline.seo: Russia Expels American, Saying He Is a C.I.A. Officer
headline.main: From Russia, With Wig: American Spy Suspect Is Ejected
headline.print_headline: From Russia, With Wig: U.S. Spy Suspect Ejected
